title: Bootstrapping Clients using the Internet Small Computer System Interface (iSCSI) Protocol
abstract:
Internet Small Computer System Interface (iSCSI) is a proposed
transport protocol for Small Computer Systems Interface (SCSI) that
operates on top of TCP.  This memo describes a standard mechanism for
enabling clients to bootstrap themselves using the iSCSI protocol.  The
goal of this standard is to enable iSCSI boot clients to obtain the
information to open an iSCSI session with the iSCSI boot server.  [STANDARDS-TRACK]
